mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, George Washington to David Stuart, 1798 February 26
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Washington, George, 1732-1799
mdRecord.dcterms:description: The education of George Washington Parke Custis (Washy), Martha Washington’s grandson, was of great importance to George Washington. Despite his constant encouragement, Washy was not particularly interested in studying. This three page letter written from Mount Vernon reveals Washington’s frustration with his adopted grandson. Autograph letter signed, 3 pages.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Custis, George Washington Parke, 1781-1857
Custis family
